page.title: 01Leamington and Warwick.
page.content: Leamington and Warwick is a very residential area and is not heavily industrialised. Warwick has a very large and beautiful castle. Leamington Spa has one of the fifteen largest cinemas in England. Leamington also has the Pump Rooms which are useful. Leamington got its title because of an under ground spring which is supposed to be good for you and is very salty. Leamington also has a very good shopping area. Warwick has a park which has a swimming pool + a paddling pool for small children and two tennis courts. The park is called St. Nicholas' Park.In 1843 Queen Victoria visited Leamington and had a statue built of her and in the Second World War a bomb displased the statue 1 inch off the base.On the bottom of the statue there is a plaque telling you about it.
